column5: i've seen conversion charts for walleye, pike and other to convert their lengths into weight - but not one for lakers. anybody seen one? we were fortunate enough to land a 33"er at springpole lake and would like to get a weight estimate.
PFE, Cant give you a conversion/estimator but a 32.5" laker I caught near Atikokan (Feb) went #11.5 and a 34" laker caught in lake superior (April) went #14.1 Xplorer
thanks for the info - i woulda guessed the laker's weight to be more than 12 pounds but maybe it was just wishful thinking. still would like to see a conversions chart if anyone has one.phish
I got 2 on O'ssulivan this year. 34 inch was 15.2 and the just short of 32 inch was 11.10 Both weighed with a normark digital scale zeroed before weighing. Rich

I have a ruler with the chart on it, but not with me. That fish would be in the 12-15 lbs range. Lake Trout seem to vary a lot in the lake I fish, so without seeing the fish or having a girth measurement it will be pretty tough to really pinpoint the weight. Either way its a really nice laker.
